sen.j: 弁内侍（べんのないじ生没年不詳）は、鎌倉時代の女流歌人。
sen.e: Ben no Naishi (dates of birth and death unknown) was a female waka poet of Kamakura period.

sen.j: 後深草院弁内侍（ごふかくさいんのべんのないじ）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: She was also called Gofukakusa-in no Ben no Naishi

sen.j: 父は藤原信実で、姉に藻璧門院少将、妹に後深草院少将内侍がいる。
sen.e: Her father was FUJIWARA no Nobuzane, her elder sister was minor captain of Sohekimonin, and her younger sister was Shosho no naishi (a maid of honor to minor captain) of Gofukakusa-in.
Her father was FUJIWARA no Nobuzane, her elder sister was Sohekimonin no shosho (minor captain), and her younger sister was Shosho no naishi (a maid of honor to minor captain) of Gofukakusa-in.

sen.j: 女房三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: She was one of the Nyobo sanjurokkasen (Thirty-six Immortal Lady Poets).

sen.j: 後深草上皇が東宮（皇太子）時代であった時から出仕し、1259年（正元元年）の譲位とともに職を退いた。
sen.e: She served since the time when the retired Emperor Gofukakusa was the Togu crown prince, and retired with his abdication in 1259.

sen.e: The famous "Bennonaishi nikki" (The Diary of Bennonaishi) was a piece of work during the first half of that period.

sen.j: 藤原雅平との間に女子（新陽明門院中納言）をもうけ、1265年（文永2年）妹の死に際して出家した。
sen.e: She had a daughter (new Middle Counselor of Yomeimon-in) with FUJIWARA no Masahira, and became a priest at death of the younger sister in 1265.
